titlestmt.titleproper: Research material on Ronald Bladen and Les Levine

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-06 17:51:47 -0400.

did.unittitle: Research material on Ronald Bladen and Les Levine

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Use of original papers requires an appointment and is limited to the Archives' Washington, D.C., Research Center. Contact Reference Services for more information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Material gathered by Berkson in preparation for exhibitions on sculptors Ronald Bladen and Les Levine.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Bladen material, compiled for a retrospective at the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art, 1991, includes: biographical material; an unpublished artists' statement, 1946; interviews of Bladen; material from the California School of Fine Art's archives, and the Whitney Museum of American Art; Bladen correspondence, 1931-1956; Berkson correspondence, 1990-1991; a painting checklist; writings by and about Bladen; photographs of Bladen's paintings and sculptures; exhibition announcements 1941-1983; and clippings and reviews, 1941-1987.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Files on Les Levine include photographs, slides, correspondence, articles, announcements, and clippings. Included are information on his media projects Subway Project (1989) and Diamond Mind.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Berkson is an art historian, curator; San Francisco, Calif. Bladen, a painter and sculptor, worked in San Francisco in the mid-1950s, and later moved to New York. Levine, a conceptual and video artist, and a curator, works in New York.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Papers of Bill Berkson, 1960-1988, are also located at the University of Connecticut's Archives & Special Collections.
